results.title: Full circle: the work of Doris Chase
results.creator_credit: Doris Chase, Elizabeth Wood and Perspective Films
results.brief_description: Documentary on painter, sculptor and filmmaker, Doris Chase. Ms Chase explains her work including the development of her sculptural furnishings for modern dance groups into video film works.

results.title: Frying methods
results.creator_credit: Dennis Shand, Film Workshop and Gas Council
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the following methods of frying foods: deep frying, shallow frying, dry frying and the frying of sweet dishes. Vegetables, fish, eggs, steak, bacon and port are some of the foods used in this film.

results.title: Frustration and fixation
results.creator_credit: Paul Ellen, Robert S. Feldman and University of Massachusetts at Amherst. Laboratory of Psychometric & Evaluation Research
results.brief_description: Documents Maier’s thesis that frustration leads to fixation and other bizarre sysmptoms. Shows a modified Lashley jumping apparatus and describes the process of teaching rats to jump. Frustrated animals finally assigned to soluble problems persist in fixations in spite of opening correct doors, and although walking trials demonstrate that they know the correct choice. Includes demonstrations of catatonic and neurotic behaviour.

results.title: Frog went a-courtin'
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: The story of Mr. Frog and Miss Mousie, made from the illustrations of Feodor Rojankovsky, and sung by John Langstaff. The story is told twice, the second time the words are superimposed on the screen facilitating audience (children) participation.

results.title: The Frog
results.creator_credit: Clyde Fisher and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Life cycle of the frog is presented. The development of the embryo is brought to the screen in a continuous scene of only a few seconds. The several changes taking place in the tadpole stages are portrayed by picture and narrative. Slow-motion photography demonstrates the graceful movements of the frog in jumping.

results.title: The French Revolution: the terror
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of France’s transformation from a shaky constitutional monarchy into a tyrannical republic (1791-1794). Focuses on the enigmatic figure of Robespierre, whose dedication and self-delusion are explored against a background of increasing upheaval and bloodshed by guillotine. In conclusion, the film moves from 18th century France to the masses brutalized by today’s totalitarian governments.

results.title: A Freighter in port
results.brief_description: A study of an ocean-going cargo vessel in port, showing how the cargo is loaded and stowed by the wharf labourers (longshoremen), and how the crew makes the ship ready for sea.

results.title: Free as the birds
results.brief_description: A schoolboy traps and cages four wild birds. When the teacher explains to his class the need to protect birds and to allow them freedom so that they can eat insects which would otherwise destroy the very food we eat, he has the courage to admit his guilt. The children go into the woods to return the birds to their natural home.
